title: C#
overview: C# has been a cornerstone of my development career, especially for game development, desktop applications, and high-performance backend services.
usage: I've used C# extensively with Unity for game development, with WPF for desktop applications, and with ASP.NET Core for web services. The strong typing and performance characteristics make it ideal for applications requiring robust architecture.
insight:
The decision between Python, TypeScript, and C# often comes down to the specific requirements of the project:

Language Best For Key Strength
Python Data science, AI/ML, rapid prototyping Readability, extensive libraries
TypeScript Web frontends, type-safe JS applications Static typing, browser compatibility
C# Games, desktop apps, performance-critical systems Performance, strong typing, Unity integration

For Edventure Trek, I chose C# with Unity because we needed:

  • Cross-platform deployment to reach more students
  • Strong performance for smooth gameplay and animations
  • The rich Unity ecosystem for educational game elements
